body: The bisect to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/1744d45c0c57af23f631c2145e8af4b185dca77f is extremely surprising. Could you verify manually that this passes on the parent commit and fails on the commit itself after a `bazel clean --expunge` each time?

Yeah I’m finding strange bisect results, so going to redo the bisect
manually.

main@HEAD seems to pass though. So it’s something specific to the 8.0.0
release branch, I think.

Ok, I've re-run backwards from 8.0.0 and the first commit where the build fails is 27487cf11f61eb23108f8df129dc1a00ee1a4370.

Verifying like this:
```
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=e749da2f60025e2462f7cc7eea0457eb5734a51a bazelisk clean --expunge
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Use --async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=e749da2f60025e2462f7cc7eea0457eb5734a51a bazelisk build ...
Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it...
WARNING: Couldn't auto load rules or symbols, because no dependency on module/repository 'rules_android' found. This will result in a failure if there's a reference to those rules or symbols.
INFO: Analyzed 5 targets (107 packages loaded, 6240 targets configured).
INFO: Found 5 targets...
INFO: Elapsed time: 26.112s, Critical Path: 17.74s
INFO: 40 processes: 37 internal, 3 darwin-sandbox.
INFO: Build completed successfully, 40 total actions

❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=27487cf11f61eb23108f8df129dc1a00ee1a4370 bazelisk clean --expunge
Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it...
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Use --async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=27487cf11f61eb23108f8df129dc1a00ee1a4370 bazelisk build ...
Starting local Bazel server and connecting to it...
WARNING: Couldn't auto load rules or symbols, because no dependency on module/repository 'rules_android' found. This will result in a failure if there's a reference to those rules or symbols.
INFO: Analyzed 5 targets (107 packages loaded, 6240 targets configured).
ERROR: /private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/external/rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs/BUILD.bazel:7:15: Action external/rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs/pip_deps_index failed: (Exit 1): index failed: error executing Action command (from target @@rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs//:pip_deps_index) bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index ... (remaining 1 argument skipped)

Use --sandbox_debug to see verbose messages from the sandbox and retain the sandbox build root for debugging
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index", line 580, in <module>
    Main()
  File "/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index", line 504, in Main
    assert os.path.exists(main_filename), \
AssertionError: Cannot exec() '/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.runfiles/_main/../rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.py': file not found.
INFO: Elapsed time: 14.971s, Critical Path: 2.08s
INFO: 39 processes: 39 internal.
ERROR: Build did NOT complete successfully
```

For good measure, this was the sequence of commits I ran:
```
c8217fdd2f20e4a061122c0af0417380d09e9480 Release 8.0.0 (2024-12-09)
946ded70aab712f986b6c8f683bb987b0eca230f [8.0.0] Only process executable path for path mapping (#24599)
a31c5e108de1173d1cfb9cfa41991a9cfb706e50 [8.0.0] Bazel Docs: Fix version selector in release docs (#24596)
47e5113eb4b4a2eed3c2f1fd72a1fa9ad551a8cc [8.0.0] Create intermediate directories when moving deeply nested undeclared outputs. (#24594)
e30aeb85738cadcfe137f2dc2758fe154a41f319 [8.0.0] Add missing rules_apple allowlist alias (#24591)
f30b5d83cf09f53650fadfd6c2be586eadf13f14 [8.0.0] Guard against NPE when calling `OperatingSystemMXBean.getCpuLoad()` (#24586)
97cf1e22a107052719944bd1465ee3935675d656 [8.0.0] Enable ignore_root_user_error for Python toolchain (#24567)
53ab6a00f473c233ea1724916902ce895cd385b3 [8.0.0] Change `@bazel_tools//tools/jdk` references to `@rules_java//toolchains` in docs (#24564)
637abb7f5820e51da47f46d31c14f231f2f587b0 [8.0.0] Don't leak `-g0` to the MSVC compiler on Windows (#24562)
1c5dd0eaeb7f8e8b65ee9d92111234300c302ca0 [8.0.0] Update `@rules_java` `v8.6.1` (#24561)
6f59a303e33727c5041fba1c27879f392b5f6bb0 [8.0.0] Make the removed java symbols compatible with `WORKSPACE` loading (#24560)
d25869ecca0c94760a652e1683b3aed55b199097 [8.0.0] Delete update-lockfiles.yml temporarily to prevent failing actions (#24541)
1b3a71b59af92b3b4bdb0ae2a56f0131f336d4b6 [8.0.0] Update concept docs for symbolic macros and visibility (#24535)
36d93eb46ab68530a0e7226d6893b959b855ef88 Revert "[8.0.0] Propagate `linkopts` of header-only libraries to `cc_shared_library`" (#24522)
0bef7530f3c7746dfa7b682c5f942b26394ca0d1 [8.0.0] Add --run_env to bazel run (#24517)
0404e84a94b19baddcdfb7a91459f187a7473135 [8.0.0] Upgrade to protobuf 29.0 (#24515)
8d66f0bbb98e5f12c24bfd783c49b59052ac155a [8.0.0] Update macro tutorial, glossary, and related docs for symbolic macros (#24512)
d64d7c3c5313a1e9bd3d8af0ed69fe1bd9fcc28f [8.0.0] Fix crashing issue with WORKSPACE (#24510)
ea0d27a3337ef838b785583de16bff5b176f66e0 [8.0.0] Cherry-pick two new logs to provide more information in dynamic execution. (#24491)
11596c3c1620a9f626ef2567d5d44e6fee7971d9 [8.0.0] Backport MODULE.bazel file changes (#24481)
9f4be82906f9403b047ec1319b2822f08cb40a0c [8.0.0] Update `@rules_java` `v8.5.1` (#24464)
7b1a82564f5ae3e376accd245a959fd5c2fcd481 [8.0.0] Fix NPE in the Starlark debugger (#24453)
43cb62aa024f2d9e8bd3b68b5297fc00aa072465 [8.0.0] Do not forward legacy `cmd.exe` variables to the server (#24456)
65a9cd02ab4a83ac0054fb69e0c639dcf39b0ed3 [8.0.0] Wrap natively created `JavaInfo` instances for `WORKSPACE` mode as well (#24454)
0cba5f5917e1d16c411ebce30b1aebe7de8fdfb9 [8.0.0] Update with_cfg to 0.6.0 (#24446)
16b609637a39fa0862c38e8d1a4297b93a462d17 [8.0.0] Re-enable symbolic macro attribute inheritance and remove --experimental_enable_macro_inherit_attrs flag (#24445)
27487cf11f61eb23108f8df129dc1a00ee1a4370 [8.0.0] Allow any attributes on non-registry overrides (#24443)
e749da2f60025e2462f7cc7eea0457eb5734a51a [8.0.0] Get `--repo_env=NAME` value from client environment (not server). (#24441)
```

I think when I tested this on master originally it was succeeding because of a cache. It still appears to be failing on master, though:
```
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=b09335b86e03732d6da2fe40a7ac07af48480771 bazelisk clean --expunge
Starting local Bazel server (no_version) and connecting to it...
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Use --async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=b09335b86e03732d6da2fe40a7ac07af48480771 bazelisk build ...
Starting local Bazel server (no_version) and connecting to it...
WARNING: Couldn't auto load rules or symbols, because no dependency on module/repository 'rules_android' found. This will result in a failure if there's a reference to those rules or symbols.
INFO: Analyzed 5 targets (107 packages loaded, 6240 targets and 26 aspects configured).
ERROR: /private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/external/rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs/BUILD.bazel:7:15: Action external/rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs/pip_deps_index failed: (Exit 1): index failed: error executing Action command (from target @@rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs//:pip_deps_index) bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index ... (remaining 1 argument skipped)

Use --sandbox_debug to see verbose messages from the sandbox and retain the sandbox build root for debugging
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index", line 580, in <module>
    Main()
  File "/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index", line 504, in Main
    assert os.path.exists(main_filename), \
AssertionError: Cannot exec() '/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.runfiles/_main/../rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.py': file not found.
INFO: Elapsed time: 15.820s, Critical Path: 2.02s

ERROR: Build did NOT complete successfully
```

issue.title: [8.1.0] Multiple aspects running py_binary based tools errors in Bazel 8

milestone.title: 8.1.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 8.1.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body:
On master, the most recent 'good' commit was eae9d4d019ca8d01bd3db5a8549b7f0e3505db61, and the subsequent 'bad' commit was 54237be06080d16a50f9c9ab0ad3a8f2651ca4d2.

```
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=eae9d4d019ca8d01bd3db5a8549b7f0e3505db61 bazelisk clean --expunge
Starting local Bazel server (no_version) and connecting to it...
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Use --async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=eae9d4d019ca8d01bd3db5a8549b7f0e3505db61 bazelisk build ...
Starting local Bazel server (no_version) and connecting to it...
WARNING: Couldn't auto load rules or symbols, because no dependency on module/repository 'rules_android' found. This will result in a failure if there's a reference to those rules or symbols.
INFO: Analyzed 5 targets (107 packages loaded, 6240 targets and 26 aspects configured).
INFO: Found 5 targets...
INFO: Elapsed time: 25.012s, Critical Path: 14.97s
INFO: 48 processes: 45 internal, 3 darwin-sandbox.
INFO: Build completed successfully, 48 total actions
```

```
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=54237be06080d16a50f9c9ab0ad3a8f2651ca4d2 bazelisk clean --expunge
Starting local Bazel server (no_version) and connecting to it...
INFO: Starting clean (this may take a while). Use --async if the clean takes more than several minutes.
❯ USE_BAZEL_VERSION=54237be06080d16a50f9c9ab0ad3a8f2651ca4d2 bazelisk build ...

INFO: Analyzed 5 targets (107 packages loaded, 6240 targets and 26 aspects configured).
ERROR: /private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/external/rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs/BUILD.bazel:7:15: Action external/rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs/pip_deps_index failed: (Exit 1): index failed: error executing Action command (from target @@rules_pydeps++reqs+reqs//:pip_deps_index) bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index ... (remaining 1 argument skipped)

Use --sandbox_debug to see verbose messages from the sandbox and retain the sandbox build root for debugging
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index", line 580, in <module>
    Main()
  File "/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index", line 504, in Main
    assert os.path.exists(main_filename), \
AssertionError: Cannot exec() '/private/var/tmp/_bazel_melliot/ec7f0e67bfc3fe3a9bd546beff97b5c5/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/1/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.runfiles/_main/../rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.py': file not found.
```

issue.title: [8.0.1] Multiple aspects running py_binary based tools errors in Bazel 8

milestone.title: 8.0.1 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 8.0.1 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body: This is extremely confusing: On the Bazel 8 release branch, the reproducer fails with https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/27487cf11f61eb23108f8df129dc1a00ee1a4370 and passes with its parent. On the master branch, it does fail with https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/1744d45c0c57af23f631c2145e8af4b185dca77f and passes with its parent for me after a clean. It also passes on current master.

When I run this with `--sandbox_debug`, I see:

```
ls -lah /private/var/tmp/_bazel_fmeum/e78feca5b66fe0e6f6d23e5ae0702f4d/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/10/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.runfiles/_main/../rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.py
lrwxr-xr-x@ 1 fmeum  wheel   130B Dec 12 21:03 /private/var/tmp/_bazel_fmeum/e78feca5b66fe0e6f6d23e5ae0702f4d/sandbox/darwin-sandbox/10/execroot/_main/bazel-out/darwin_arm64-opt-exec-ST-c6280171b4e4/bin/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.runfiles/_main/../rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.py -> /private/var/tmp/_bazel_fmeum/e78feca5b66fe0e6f6d23e5ae0702f4d/execroot/_main/external/rules_pydeps+/pydeps/private/index/index.py
```

The target of the symlink (in fact, the entire `external/rules_pydeps+` directory) is missing when the build fails. It's possible that this is happening non-deterministically, which throws off our bisect. This looks similar to past issues with Skymeld.

If I keep running `bazel clean --expunge && bazel build //...` on 54237be06080d16a50f9c9ab0ad3a8f2651ca4d2 (but not master), it repeatedly fails. If I run it with `--noexperimental_merged_skyframe_analysis_execution` it repeatedly passes.

@joeleba
